review_text:
We really enjoyed our stay at Gary's place in The Villages. We would consider staying there again and would not hesitate to recommend it to others.
The home is in a quiet and peaceful neighborhood tucked away from the busier areas of The Villages, but at the same time those areas are just a short ride away whenever you want them. Lake Sumter Landing and the Colony Plaza shopping center are roughly equal distances away. There is a Winn-Dixie at Sumter Landing and a Publix at Colony, we visited both and preferred the Publix. We enjoyed the mature landscaping in this part of The Villages, especially during walks or bike rides.
The home has a split floorplan that worked very well for us and everything was very clean. Check-in was a breeze. The listing photos are very accurate but once we arrived we felt the home was even nicer than we expected. There are ceiling fans in every room and solar tubes in certain areas that brighten up the interior. Being on a corner lot with an oversized side yard was ideal for walking our small dog without potentially bothering neighbors.
We opted to add the golf cart to our rental and we're glad we did. It adds so much to the experience of The Villages. If you haven't driven a golf cart in The Villages before, we'd highly recommend watching some YouTube videos that cover basic operation and the rules of the road (paths, tunnels, avoiding roundabouts, etc.). A good one can be found by searching "villages newcomers golf cart do's and dont's".
Having a private pool available at the house was a big bonus. It was just the right size for cooling off after a warm day. We had a little confusion about the operation of the pool at first but got it sorted out soon enough. A tip for future guests is that you will have no doubt about whether the heater is on, it makes a low-frequency rumble when it is active but we did not find it bothersome. Also just as a frame of reference it took about 3 hours to heat the pool from 70 to 87 degrees which seems pretty reasonable given the volume of water. But that may not always be necessary.
As mentioned in other reviews, Gary is great with communication. We didn't need much but when we did, Gary was responsive, thorough and professional.

There are currently 4 Squares with one more being built. In these Squares, there are restaurants and live bands that play every day of the year. So much fun! As mentioned above- Sumpter is closest but they are all great.

From the moment you drive up to this cute little Villa you will be enchanted. The exterior is landscaped with several sitting areas as well as an outdoor dining table. You enter into a four season lanai with a pretty turquoise wicker dining table and chairs [we ate all our meals out there] If the weather is nice you can open the windows and a lovely breeze comes through. If too hot, close them down and the AC keeps the room very comfortable. From the Lanai you use your own security code to enter this lovely crafting heaven! There is a HUGE crafting DreamBox and dining table on your left, and a comfy sitting area in front of your. The DreamBox is filled to the brim with everything a crafter could want on their visit. All the equipment, tools, paper, pens, markers, paper, vinyl, etc. There were extra six foot tables in garage to allow crafters extra room to craft. The kitchen has all the appliances you need to make your stay comfy, plus another dining area! The frig was filled with water bottles, with plenty of room for our own groceries there and in the pantry. The bathroom is a nice size with a great tub/shower. Both bedrooms have queen size beds and tons of pillows, nice size closets for all your clothing. There is a linen closet stocked with linens, a yoga mat, etc. This host provides a smart TV in sitting room and both bedrooms. You are able to get Amazon Prime, YouTube, Disney+, Netflix, and a host of other stations. The host has also provided Alexa+ so surround music is available plus of course Alexa is there to answer your questions.
Our stay was spectacular. The two of us went for a crafty vacation, to focus on crafting and nothing else. Melody Lane's Crafty Getaway was a dream. We will be back, just trying to figure out how often we can return. You will not be disappointed.

review_text:
We review Airbnb rentals according to our experience and have no reason what so ever to make false statements.
There were some issues with this rental and Airbnb is aware of them.
The guest passes that the listing states are provided by the host were not. We had to go and get them on our own.
The WIFI went out during our stay, yes-these things happen-but I think it is extremely unusual for us to have to be at the rental for the repair tech to arrive and remain there until the problem was fixed.
Both of these things were an inconvenience for us, as they would be for most people while on vacation. However, when we requested a nominal amount to be refunded to us because of this, Jennifer stated that " Internet is a luxury, not a requirement so your choice to make it a big deal and spend the time fixing it is not my problem." The issue with the guest passes received a similar response, "The guest passes are also not a required perk of your stay."
Keep in mind both of the items are listed as available amenities.
The home itself is only surface clean. In every closet in the home there are personal items stuffed in the corners on the shelves and the floor. There was food in the refrigerator that was out of date and there was laundry left in the washing machine from the previous guest or the housekeeper. These things didn't effect us because we didn't use the closets or the washing machine and we never eat any food left from previous guests or the host, it's just an FYI for future guests.
We always communicate through Airbnb so we have a record of all communications, and we also are in the habit of taking a lot of pictures of things we will be reviewing in case they would be needed.
We travel extensively and this is the first time we requested a refund of any kind from any host.
We would not recommend this rental to friends or family.
